summary: So I’ve been checking out the Talks Machina since they’re on youtube now (which I didn’t know before) and so basically Caduceus...
body:
So I’ve been checking out the Talks Machina since they’re on youtube now (which I didn’t know before) and so basically Caduceus is in his late teens (since firbolg reach adult age at 30 and Taliesin said he’s between 23-26 firbolg years)

Which I find very fascinating and on par with his innocence and disinterest for anything remotely sexual so far. I feel like this is a behaviour similar to what Jester might have developped if she didn’t grew up in a brothel.

This also makes me so excited to see his interactions with his brother and sisters if/when we get to meet them.

summary: These assholes have got to stop casting mind-altering magic on each other.  And on a lighter note, they now have both of...
body:
These assholes have got to stop casting mind-altering magic on each other. 

And on a lighter note, they now have both of Jester’s pets with them! Underwater! In a secret tunnel! This’ll go great, I’m sure.

blog.name: blackestglass
blog.title: Obsidian Musings
blog.description:
Bless you, if you've made it here. This blog is a multifandom mess. Fandoms include Critical Role, Hamilton, MCU, Pacific Rim, Elementary, Brooklyn Nine Nine, LotR, Firefly, Harry Potter, Sailor Moon, K-Pop, and many others.  I post A LOT of cute animals and babies, pictures of unfairly attractive celebrities, social justice posts, and pretty things that catch my eye. I REALLY like puns. On Wednesdays, I do No White Dude Wednesdays (NWDW) where I spam my dash with pictures and historical posts of POCs and transgender people. Occasionally, I commit podfic.
Also, I apparently do fanfiction now.
I am also on Twitter.

excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Title: why wrestle the tide
Author: sabinelagrande
Reader: blackglass
Rating: E
Fandom: Critical Role
Pairings: Percy/Grog/Vex
Summary:  Sometimes Percy gets a bit out of sorts, but luckily, Vex knows how to sort him out.
Length: 13:38
Download: Right click and save as a LQ mp3 (for storage considerations) or as a HQ mp3. (Thanks to paraka for hosting!)

Streaming available at the link!

Notes: As always, my girl, Sabine, comes through with me when I need kink-specific fic. Used to fill my “kinky” and “naked” squares for podfic_bingo. Thanks to @stickthisbig for having bp!

tags: kinda don't know what else to tag it as
summary: You know, I do wonder if the woman who resurrected Nott and Lucien/Molly was a consecuted soul raised outside of the Kryn...
body:
You know, I do wonder if the woman who resurrected Nott and Lucien/Molly was a consecuted soul raised outside of the Kryn Dynasty (assuming those two women are the same person, which is a theory I am 100% behind)

Because - imagine you’re a teenage-ish mage, who keeps having dreams/visions about something strange, about another life that you may have had. And no one around you has a similar experience, and you go to the Soltryce Academy and look for answers, and the closest thing you can find is reincarnation. So of course you become obsessed with reincarnation, with bringing people back from the dead into new bodies (or if the spell goes wrong, new souls into the same body). And this is too close to necromancy, which is outlawed in the Dwendalian Empire, so you’re going to practice on individuals who are, let’s say, off the Empire’s radar, like Lucien’s group or a halfling that goblins kidnapped and whose family probably thinks is dead

blog.name: sparxwrites
blog.title: The Bookshop
blog.description:
"Be not inhospitable to strangers, lest they be angels in disguise."

The writing blog of Sparx. Please feel free to come in, have a cup of tea, and snoop around a little! You might even find something that takes your fancy...

This blog contains 18+ content.

You can find my fics on AO3, and my mixes (both fan and otherwise) at The Old Record Shop (8tracks) and The New Record Shop (spotify).

My main fandom at the moment is Critical Role. Previous fandoms include the Yogscast, Supernatural, Red vs. Blue, and various others, as well as a few pieces of original work - check out the Tags of Interest page for navigation help.

tags: (not really; it's self-surgery but probly similar enough it'd hit the same triggers)
summary: Caleb is careful, as best he can be. The chips are long settled in, itching, shattered beneath the skin and scarred in deep. Ten...
body:
Caleb is careful, as best he can be. The chips are long settled in, itching, shattered beneath the skin and scarred in deep. Ten years, it’s been, he will learn later, when he is more than five desperate miles from the asylum and shaking at the edge of a river he will eventually have to ford – ten years lost to an asylum, ten years of his parents dead, ten years of things under his skin that should never have been there working their way deeper below fat and muscle.

Ten years is a long time for nerves and sinew to grow around foreign material. For gems put there without his consent to have been made part of his body.

He has a knife, stolen from a guard and still crusted with his keeper’s blood, and the stream in front of him. When he clicks his fingers once, twice, the magic curled deep inside him flickers, flares erratically, and he doesn’t know whether to laugh or cry or vomit when flame begins to burn on his index fingertip.

It’s still there. After all this time, it’s still inside him.

The knife glows cherry-red for a half-second as he passes it through the flame, and he waits a minute for it to cool. He wants to sterilise, not cauterise – this will make scars enough without searing deep holes into his arms.

Then he sets the blade to the first of the bulges in his arm, this one so high up it seems to have migrated from his wrist to the back of his hand, and makes the first incision.

He has a good grasp of anatomy, courtesy of- a man whose name he will not say, not even in the privacy of his own head. He knows where the tendons are, the major veins and arteries, and he avoids them all as he slices through the back of his hand, nearly down to the fine bones of it. He shakes, drools around the strip of fabric he’d pushed between his teeth, but keeps going until the tip of the blade grinds against a gemstone facet.

A little bit of maneuvering, a small flip of the knife-tip, and the first gem slides free – warm yellow citrine turned orange with the slick blood-film over the top of it. It hits the dirt almost soundlessly, and Caleb allows himself the brief privilege of screaming through his nose, hunching over and shaking.

Then he sets the tip of his knife against the inside of his wrist, and starts again.

It takes over an hour to get them all on that arm. He works steadily, meticulously, allowing himself barely a handful of seconds between each incision to give into the pain before reigning himself in. By the time the last gem hits the dirt, he is pale, swaying, arm streaked with blood and fear-sweat from the seventeen incisions.

He should stay awake, he knows, keep watch for pursuers or predators, stay vigilant. But the knife falls from his shaking fingers into the pile of bloodied gems, the cloth falls from his mouth, and he curls trembling into the dirt. He’s gone the moment his shoulder touches the ground.

He doesn’t dream.

When he wakes up, exhausted, shaking- he clicks his fingers, sterilises the knife once more, switches it to his left hand. And he starts again.
body_abstract:
Caleb is careful, as best he can be. The chips are long settled in, itching, shattered beneath the skin and scarred in deep. Ten years, it’s been, he will learn later, when he is more than five desperate miles from the asylum and shaking at the edge of a river he will eventually have to ford – ten years lost to an asylum, ten years of his parents dead, ten years of things under his skin that should never have been there working their way deeper below fat and muscle.

Ten years is a long time for nerves and sinew to grow around foreign material. For gems put there without his consent to have been made part of his body.

He has a knife, stolen from a guard and still crusted with his keeper’s blood, and the stream in front of him. When he clicks his fingers once, twice, the magic curled deep inside him flickers, flares erratically, and he doesn’t know whether to laugh or cry or vomit when flame begins to burn on his index fingertip.

It’s still there. After all this time, it’s still inside him.

The knife glows cherry-red for a half-second as he passes it through the flame, and he waits a minute for it to cool. He wants to sterilise, not cauterise – this will make scars enough without searing deep holes into his arms.

Then he sets the blade to the first of the bulges in his arm, this one so high up it seems to have migrated from his wrist to the back of his hand, and makes the first incision.

He works steadily, meticulously, allowing himself barely a handful of seconds between each incision to give into the pain before reigning himself in. By the time the last gem hits the dirt, he is pale, swaying, arm streaked with blood and fear-sweat from the seventeen incisions.

He should stay awake, he knows, keep watch for pursuers or predators, stay vigilant. But the knife falls from his shaking fingers into the pile of bloodied gems, the cloth falls from his mouth, and he curls trembling into the dirt. He’s gone the moment his shoulder touches the ground.

He doesn’t dream.

When he wakes up, exhausted, shaking- he clicks his fingers, sterilises the knife once more, switches it to his left hand. And he starts again.

trail.content_raw:
Caleb is careful, as best he can be. The chips are long settled in, itching, shattered beneath the skin and scarred in deep. Ten years, it’s been, he will learn later, when he is more than five desperate miles from the asylum and shaking at the edge of a river he will eventually have to ford – ten years lost to an asylum, ten years of his parents dead, ten years of things under his skin that should never have been there working their way deeper below fat and muscle.

Ten years is a long time for nerves and sinew to grow around foreign material. For gems put there without his consent to have been made part of his body.

He has a knife, stolen from a guard and still crusted with his keeper’s blood, and the stream in front of him. When he clicks his fingers once, twice, the magic curled deep inside him flickers, flares erratically, and he doesn’t know whether to laugh or cry or vomit when flame begins to burn on his index fingertip.

It’s still there. After all this time, it’s still inside him.

The knife glows cherry-red for a half-second as he passes it through the flame, and he waits a minute for it to cool. He wants to sterilise, not cauterise – this will make scars enough without searing deep holes into his arms.

Then he sets the blade to the first of the bulges in his arm, this one so high up it seems to have migrated from his wrist to the back of his hand, and makes the first incision.

[[MORE]]

He has a good grasp of anatomy, courtesy of- a man whose name he will not say, not even in the privacy of his own head. He knows where the tendons are, the major veins and arteries, and he avoids them all as he slices through the back of his hand, nearly down to the fine bones of it. He shakes, drools around the strip of fabric he’d pushed between his teeth, but keeps going until the tip of the blade grinds against a gemstone facet.

A little bit of maneuvering, a small flip of the knife-tip, and the first gem slides free – warm yellow citrine turned orange with the slick blood-film over the top of it. It hits the dirt almost soundlessly, and Caleb allows himself the brief privilege of screaming through his nose, hunching over and shaking.

Then he sets the tip of his knife against the inside of his wrist, and starts again.

It takes over an hour to get them all on that arm. He works steadily, meticulously, allowing himself barely a handful of seconds between each incision to give into the pain before reigning himself in. By the time the last gem hits the dirt, he is pale, swaying, arm streaked with blood and fear-sweat from the seventeen incisions.

He should stay awake, he knows, keep watch for pursuers or predators, stay vigilant. But the knife falls from his shaking fingers into the pile of bloodied gems, the cloth falls from his mouth, and he curls trembling into the dirt. He’s gone the moment his shoulder touches the ground.

He doesn’t dream.

When he wakes up, exhausted, shaking- he clicks his fingers, sterilises the knife once more, switches it to his left hand. And he starts again.
trail.content:

Then he sets the blade to the first of the bulges in his arm, this one so high up it seems to have migrated from his wrist to the back of his hand, and makes the first incision.

He has a good grasp of anatomy, courtesy of- a man whose name he will not say, not even in the privacy of his own head. He knows where the tendons are, the major veins and arteries, and he avoids them all as he slices through the back of his hand, nearly down to the fine bones of it. He shakes, drools around the strip of fabric he’d pushed between his teeth, but keeps going until the tip of the blade grinds against a gemstone facet.

A little bit of maneuvering, a small flip of the knife-tip, and the first gem slides free – warm yellow citrine turned orange with the slick blood-film over the top of it. It hits the dirt almost soundlessly, and Caleb allows himself the brief privilege of screaming through his nose, hunching over and shaking.

Then he sets the tip of his knife against the inside of his wrist, and starts again.

It takes over an hour to get them all on that arm. He doesn’t dream.

When he wakes up, exhausted, shaking- he clicks his fingers, sterilises the knife once more, switches it to his left hand. And he starts again.
